de.iabg.math
Class RectangularMatrix

java.lang.Object
  de.iabg.math.AbstractMatrix
      de.iabg.math.RectangularMatrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
Matrix
Direct Known Subclasses:
ModeCorrelationMatrix, ModeMatrix, NodeCorrelationMatrix, NodeMatrix
public class RectangularMatrix
extends AbstractMatrix

This Matrix is designed as a standard fully populated matrix. This matrix stores all values in a single row-major array, where each subsequent row is appended to the previous. This structure is used to improve performance over the implementation of standard 2D arrays. This single array structure can be useful for copying or assigning values, for example, in Java3D.

Version:
September 10, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

sortColumns

public void sortColumns(KeyList columnKeys)
Sorts and resizes the number of columns in this matrix according to the order of the given column names. The number of given column names may be smaller than the number of column names in this matrix, thus reducing the number of columns. The corresponding cells of the given columns are also sorted in the same way. The data of any column which is omitted will be lost.

Parameters:
columnKeys - the new order of the column names

sortRows

public void sortRows(KeyList rowKeys)
Sorts and resizes the number of rows in this matrix according to the order of the given row names. The number of given row names may be smaller than the number of row names in this matrix, thus reducing the number of rows. The number of given row names may also contain duplicate values, thus increasing the number of rows. The corresponding cells of the given rows are also sorted in the same way. The data of any row which is omitted will be lost.

Parameters:
rowKeys - the new order of the row names

swapColumns

lastIndex - the last column index
